questions.title: No sensitive information exposed in the repository
questions.description: For example: secret token, mailer details, CartoDB access, Amazon keys, user data

questions.title: Standard config store or description of a non-standard config in the README
questions.description: For example: database.yml & secrets.yml is standard for Rails 4

questions.title: No hardcoded urls, emails or other pieces of configuration in code
questions.description: For example: third-party API urls, notification emails

questions.title: Relevant passwords shared through the Admin Password DB
questions.description: For example: access details to any third party APIs

questions.title: Gemfile.lock with versions locked for futureproofing
questions.description: For example:gems that depend on system or external APIs

questions.title: Gemfile cleaned from unused gems & upgraded to reasonable versions
questions.description: For example: no gems with security flaws, no serious issues reported by Gemnasium

questions.title: Test coverage > 80%
questions.description: For example: simplecov, CodeClimate

questions.title: Exception notification configured
questions.description: email / slack notifications configured or tracking service in place

questions.title: Brakeman tests passed
questions.description: http://brakemanscanner.org/ or security report in CodeClimate

questions.title: Rails Best Practices passed
questions.description: https://github.com/railsbp/rails_best_practices

questions.title: RuboCop passed
questions.description: https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop

questions.title: Automated multi-stage deployment scripts
questions.description: For example: Capistrano for Rails applications

questions.title: Number of releases to keep limited through the deployment script
questions.description: For example: 5 releases for production, 3 for staging

questions.title: Production instance documented in Labs
questions.description: Any temporary or experimental instances should be documented as well, no zombie sites

questions.title: Staging instance documented in Labs
questions.description: Any temporary or experimental instances should be documented as well, no zombie sites

questions.title: Background jobs configured
questions.description: For example: redis installed, redis db assigned

questions.title: Background jobs documented in Labs
questions.description: For example: redis connection string if sidekiq / redis workers are used on shared hosts

questions.title: Cron jobs configured
questions.description: For Rails applications as part of deploy script, e.g. via whenever gem

questions.title: Backups configured
questions.description: Both database & file system (where applicable)

questions.title: Backups documented in Labs
questions.description: Backup locations

questions.title: Email service configured
questions.description: Make sure site actually sends out emails (if applicable)

questions.title: Availability monitoring configured for all subsystems
questions.description: For example: nagios checks for web application & sidekiq workers

questions.title: Performance monitoring configured
questions.description: For example: New Relic set up

questions.title: Site renders properly in IE
questions.description: Most of the time versions 9+ need to be considered

questions.title: Site renders properly on mobile devices
Commented out code & obsolete documentation removed
questions.description: Especially outdated setup instructions

questions.title: Temporary installations & zombie sites cleaned up
questions.description: Also temporary databases, especially if they contain user data

questions.title: robots.txt in place
questions.description: Admin paths mustn't be exposed

questions.title: Load tests passed
questions.description: For example: stress testing with siege
